brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to collect in vivo human image data to demonstrate neurological
      magnetic resonance imaging of subjects using short pulse sequences.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Using Innovative Pulse Sequences
clinical_study.condition: Head Images With and Without Contrast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject must be at least 18 years of age

          -  Subject must be willing and able to undergo verbal and written informed consent

          -  Subject must have a clinical indication for a head MRI with and without
             Gadolinium-based contrast agent administration

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects who have any of the conditions below at the time of the enrollment or scan
             session are excluded from this study. Further, should it be determined by study staff
             that an enrolled subject meets any of the conditions below during the course of the
             study, the subject will be removed from the study.

               -  Any contraindication to an MRI scan per the policy of Spectrum Health

               -  Any contraindication to administration of an MRI contrast agent per the policy
                  of Spectrum Health

               -  Off-label utilization of contrast agents administered for the subject's clinical
                  exam

intervention.intervention_name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Using Innovative Pulse Sequences

clinical_study.official_title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Using Innovative Pulse Sequences

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Collect head human images and associated technical and clinical information to demonstrate neurological magnetic resonance imaging of subjects using short pulse sequence.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
